# Warcrimes – journalists {#sec-warcrimes-journalists}

::: {.callout-caution title="Myth"}
- Journalists travel to Ukraine to perform crimes.
- Ukraine kills journalists.
[<br>![Search for topic in EUvsDisinfo](../all_common_img/EUvsDisinfo_400x240.jpg){height=2em}](https://euvsdisinfo.eu/disinformation-cases/?text=war%20(crimes%7Ccriminals)%20(civilian%7Ccivilians)&sort=relevance)
:::

::: {.callout-tip title="Truth"}
Russia murdered more than 100 journalists in Ukraine.
:::

> Journalists and their equipment enjoy immunity, the former as civilians, the latter as a result of the general protection that international humanitarian law grants to civilian objects. However, this immunity is not absolute. Journalists are protected only as long as they do not take a direct part in the hostilities. 
>
> ICRC (2025)[^warcrimes-journalists-1]  

Between 2022, February 24, and 2024, November 29, the National Union of Journalists of Ukraine lists 18 journalists killed on duty, 9 journalists killed in their free time and 80 journalists killed in the ranks of the Armed Forces of Ukraine[^warcrimes-journalists-2].

[^warcrimes-journalists-1]: ICRC 2025). Protection of Journalists. [https://casebook.icrc.org/case-study/protection-journalists](https://casebook.icrc.org/case-study/protection-journalists)
